series.title: Startups For the Rest of Us
series.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 329 | How to Make Your Customers Successful
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary:
In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to make your customers successful. Just putting out a functioning app isn't enough, the guys talk through some points to help your customers navigate the ins and outs of your app.
       

Related Stories

  • Episode 328 | Updates on Drip and Bluetick
  • Episode 327 | Supporting 700+ services w/ Wade Foster
  • Episode 326 | Building a Local vs. a Remote Team

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 328 | Updates on Drip and Bluetick
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 327 | Supporting 700+ services w/ Wade Foster
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary:
In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Wade Foster of Zapier, about supporting over 700 services. Wade gives a brief history of Zapier as well as how they went from zero to 1.5 million users in 5 years. He also shares some early marketing techniques he used.
       

Related Stories

  • Episode 329 | How to Make Your Customers Successful
  • Episode 328 | Updates on Drip and Bluetick
  • Episode 326 | Building a Local vs. a Remote Team

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 326 | Building a Local vs. a Remote Team
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 325 | Building a Killer Email Launch Sequence
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary:
In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of us, Rob and Mike talk about building a killer email launch sequence. Drawing from their collective experiences launching various books, software products, SaaS apps, and membership websites they discuss their thoughts and framework on the topic. Some of the points discussed in detail include elements of a sale letter, how many emails to send, and things to do on launch day.
      

Related Stories

  • Episode 329 | How to Make Your Customers Successful
  • Episode 328 | Updates on Drip and Bluetick
  • Episode 327 | Supporting 700+ services w/ Wade Foster

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 324 | Idea Validation & Risk Avoidance
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary:
In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about idea validation and risk avoidance. They list 10 fundamental questions that need to be answered when starting a new product.
      

Related Stories

  • Episode 329 | How to Make Your Customers Successful
  • Episode 328 | Updates on Drip and Bluetick
  • Episode 327 | Supporting 700+ services w/ Wade Foster

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 323 | Funding, Acquisitions, Firing and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 322 | Sex & Software (An Interview with Brianna Wu)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 321 | How to Take Your SaaS Upmarket
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary:
In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to take your SaaS upmarket. Some of the steps they discuss include, raising prices, modifying your pricing page, asking for annual contracts, and how to give demos.
      

Related Stories

  • Episode 329 | How to Make Your Customers Successful
  • Episode 328 | Updates on Drip and Bluetick
  • Episode 327 | Supporting 700+ services w/ Wade Foster

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 320 | Business Model Breakdown of Amazon Go
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 319 | Questions about the Technical Side of SaaS
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike answer listener questions about technical sides of SaaS. Some of the topics include pros and cons of including marketing website in main codebase, SaaS quality, and re-engaging a cold email list.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 318 | Our Goals for 2017
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike make their goals for 2017. In addition to setting their new goals, they also talk about last year's goals and how they did.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 317 | Our Predictions for 2017
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike make their predictions for 2017. They also look back on the previous year’s predictions and evaluate whether or not they were correct.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 316 | Subscription Pricing Models? Challenge Accepted.
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about overcoming challenges with subscription pricing models. They dive into how to test selling subscription based products, deciding between one-time, monthly, or annually, how to raise prices, how to lower prices, and how to avoid overpaying for support.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 315 | On Attending Conferences, Opening a Bank Account, and Project Management Tools
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about attending conferences, opening business bank accounts, project management tools, and more listener questions.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 314 | Management Lessons for Founders
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about management lessons for founders. This episode is geared towards how to manage a team of people and discusses the two extremes of a highly involved micro-manager versus allowing people to work independently.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 313 | The Viability of SaaS, Cutting-edge Technologies, and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike answer a number of listener questions including if SaaS is still viable for microprenuers, latest technology they are excited about, and some book recommendations.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 312 | 9 Ways to Introduce New Ideas into Your Business
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about different ways to introduce new ideas into your business. These are ways to broaden your horizons as a business owner and learn how other people may be solving the same problem you are but doing so in different ways.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 311 | What It’s Like Selling a $128k Side Project (With Guest Derrick Reimer)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us Rob interviews Derrick Reimer about the selling of his product Codetree. They discuss everything from the inception of the idea, to gaining traction, to launching, and finally the negotiation and sale.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 310 | Indie.vc and a More Realistic Approach to Funding
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob interviews Bryce Roberts of Indie.vc about their unique approach to funding startups and their terms. Rob shares his opinions on raising funding and angel investments.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 309 | Updates on Bluetick.io & Drip
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike give some updates on Bluetick and Drip. Mike gives some details of overcoming technical challenges and how he plans to shift his focus to a marketing. Rob talks about some of the changes to Drip since the acquisition as well as ways his role has changed.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 308 | Work-work Balance, Living A Process-Based Life, and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss work-work balance, living a processed based life, angel investing, and answer more listener questions. Mike also gives an in depth update on his progress with BlueTick, and Rob helps define angel investing and shares some ways to make a possible return on your investment.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 307 | Is the Micropreneur Dream Still Alive?
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike inspired by a listener question, talk about whether or not the Micropreneur dream is still alive. Some of the topics discussed include reasons to start a business, stages of micropreneurship, and legacy.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 306 | Mixing Subscription and One-time Pricing, Angel Investing, Options for Recurring Payments, and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike answer some listener questions including mixing subscription and one time pricing, options for reoccurring payments, affiliate programs and more. Mike also gives some recent updates on his progress with BlueTick.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 305 | Strategies for Taking Pre-orders for a New Product
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to take pre-orders for a new product. These are strategies that can be used to help gain interest and validate a product. They also discuss some motivations and benefits to taking pre-orders.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 304 | From Bootstrapped to Funded and Back to Bootstrapped with Simon Payne
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob talks to Simon Payne, a co-founder of Leadpages, about his journey from being a bootstrapped developer, to raising funding, and eventually moving on from Leadpages and developing his own product.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 303 | Our Favorite Tabletop Games
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about their favorite table top games. Deviating from the typical topics, they change things up and reveal some games they enjoy as a personal hobby. They put the games into 3 different categories by age range and difficulty and share some stories on how their families and kids enjoy them.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 302 | 8 Key Takeaways from MicroConf Europe 2016
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss 8 key takeaways from MicroConf Europe 2016. A couple weeks after the conference they highlight some of their favorite points from the speaker's talks. Also detailed notes from the entire conference are available at microconfeuroperecap.com.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 301 | Six Decision Making Tips for Entrepreneurs
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about decision making for entrepreneurs. They walk you through some decision making techniques and look at how they can help you make decisions faster and more efficiently.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 300 | The 4 Unfair Advantages for Faster SaaS Growth
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk live at MicroConf Europe about the four unfair advantages to faster SaaS growth. They also expand the topic to things that seem like unfair advantages but aren’t and how to improve your chances of getting an unfair advantage. At the end of the talk they do a short Q&A with some audience members.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 299.5 | Ten Lessons Every Startup Founder Should Learn from Bill Walsh
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about a book by former head coach of the San Francisco 49ers Bill Walsh, about his standards of performance. Rob and Mike pull out 10 different points from the book that are most relevant to a startup founder and elaborate on them.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 299 | 7 Entrepreneurial Blind Spots
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about 7 entrepreneurial blind spots. They outline some areas that people can overlook but can potentially cause issues down the road. This topic was inspired by a case study Mike is putting together on self-funded launch statistics to help people make better decisions for their business.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 298 | A Startup Acquisition Story
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob talks about the acquisition of his company Drip, by Leadpages. After finally closing the deal and making it public, Rob is able to talk about the thought process, negotiation timeline, and address some of the commonly asked questions about the acquisition.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 297 | How to Charge for Startup Ideas (With Guest Ken Wallace)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob interviews Ken Wallace, of MastermindJam, about his new project Nugget. Nugget is a subscription based product that sends you startup ideas on a monthly basis. Ken talks about the origins of Nugget, some of the negative and positive feedback he got pre-launch, as well as his launch strategies.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 296 | Launching 100 Projects in One Year
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Justin Jackson about launching 100 projects in a year. Justin talks about the goals and idea behind his MegaMaker project. He talks about some of the products he has come up with and how he went about marketing those products.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 295 | How to Get Your First 10 SaaS Customers
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to get your first 10 SaaS customers. They reference a ParseHub blog post about the beginning stages of their startup. Rob and Mike walk you through the steps of this article and how you might be able to replicate their success.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 294 | Back of the Envelope Business Model Test
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about back of the envelope business model test. This episode is loosely based on chapter 2 of the book, Scaling Lean: Mastering the Key Metrics for Startup Growth. Some of the points discussed are defining your minimum success criteria and converting revenue goals to customer acquisition.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 293 | The 6 Biggest Email Marketing Myths
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about the six biggest email marketing myths. The episode is put together around an unbounce.com blog post. Rob and Mike discuss whether they agree or disagree with the myths mentioned in this article.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 292 |  Moving from One-time to Subscription Revenue, When Your Core Product Has Variable Costs, and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike answer a number of listener questions on topics including moving from one-time to subscription revenue, when your core product has variable costs, and how to disrupt the current payment method for a market. Mike also gives some updates and recent challenges with BlueTick.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 291 | Freemium, Asking for CC Up-front, and a Big Mistake First-time Founders Make (with Guest David Cancel)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob interviews David Cancel, of Drift, about whether or not to use freemium, innovating versus inventing, and the topic of asking for credit cards upfront. David also shares some upcoming topics that will be covered on future episodes of his podcast.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 290 | Public Speaking as a Sales Channel with Rachel Andrew
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Rachel Andrew about public speaking as a sales channel. They discuss the advantages and disadvantages and challenges you will face as a public speaker. Rachel also shares some of her processes and success stories of overcoming public speaking anxiety.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 289 | A Short Guide to Online Presales for SaaS & Software
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike give you a short guide to online presales for SaaS and software. Some of the topics they dive into include inbound leads, sales funnels, lead qualification, and general sales process for buyers.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 288 | How to Choose and Test a Paid Marketing Channel
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss how to choose and test a paid marketing channel. They talk about the mindset and approach as well as criteria for making the right choice for your business.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 287 | 5 High Leverage Areas Bootstrappers Should Focus On
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about five different areas bootstrappers should focus their time on. You're not going to have time to do everything and some things should be a lower priority.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 286 | Five Guidelines for Balancing Learning and Doing
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk through five guidelines for balancing learning and doing. They help define when learning and consuming too much information can actually impede the progression of your business.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 285 | How to Make Your First Hire
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to make your first hire. They discuss how to decide if you need to hire full-time or part-time, the pros and cons of each, and some tips on the hiring process.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 284 | Key Takeaways from MicroConf 2016
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss several of their takeaways pulled from talks at MicroConf 2016.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 283 | Stair-Stepping Into a Different Audience
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to stair-step into a new audience. They define what the stair step approach is, ways to get into a new market, and how to utilize your existing strengths on your new audience.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 282 | The Long, Slow SaaS Ramp of Death
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss the long, slow, SaaS ramp of death. They define it, tell you how to recognize it, share their own experiences with it, and give tips on how to get out of it using tactical and mental coping mechanisms.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 281 | Tools You’ll Need for Your Bootstrapped Startup
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of us, Rob and Mike talk about tools you’ll need for your bootstrapped startup. They discuss the different options to choose from pertaining to the pre/post revenue stages of your business.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 280 | The Productivity Project with Guest Chris Bailey
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob interviews Chris Bailey, author of The Productivity Project. They discuss aspects of the book and Chris shares some of his personal experiences with productivity techniques both successful and unsuccessful.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 279 | How Google’s New Search Results Will Affect You
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Dave Collins, SEO and internet marketing expert about Google’s new search results. They discuss how these recent changes will affect small business owners and what you should be doing to stay up to date.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 278 | How to Build and Launch a Membership Website
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike share their experience and give insight on steps to validate, build and launch a membership website. They also give tips on how to decide whether a membership site is the right platform for your idea.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 277 | Five Ways to Structure Your Startup Mastermind
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about five ways to structure your mastermind. They list some different formats to try and the pros and cons to each.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 276 | Handling Failed Payments, Cold Calling, and Staying Accountable
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about handling failed payments, cold calling, and staying accountable. These topics come from more listener questions and Rob and Mike share their expertise and advice on the subjects.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 275 |  How to Influence Decision Makers on Your Pricing Page
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to influence decision makers on your pricing page. Inspired by a listener question they give you some tips on how to optimize for better conversion.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 274 |  How to Mentally & Technically Prepare For Your Launch (With Guest Derrick Reimer)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and guest Derrick Reimer of Drip, talk about how to mentally and technically prepare for your launch. They give you first hand advice from things they learned and experienced when launching a new feature to their product.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 273 | Company Identity, Using Accountability Emails, and SaaS Project Management
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike answer a number of listener questions including topics about company identity, using accountability emails, and SaaS project management.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 272 | Planning For Your Imminent Demise
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss a listener question about planning for your imminent demise. They talk about how to prepare for the worst and give examples of things they have put in place themselves.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 271 | Lessons Learned Analyzing 250 SaaS Pricing Pages
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about lessons learned analyzing 250 SaaS pricing pages. They give their opinions and takeaways on the article and how it may apply to smaller size SaaS businesses/products.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 270 | Our Predictions for 2016
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike make their predictions for 2016, forecasting bootstrapping related topics as well as the greater technology space.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 269 | Our Goals for 2016 (Plus We Review our 2015 Goals)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike review their 2015 goals and talk about whether or not they were able to achieve them and the reasons to why they were successful or not. They also set their new goals for the upcoming year.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 268 | How to Set Annual Goals
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about setting your yearly goals and some processes to use in order to make sure you meet those goals.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 267 | How to Structure Your SaaS Support Team
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike speak from their first hand experiences about how to structure a SaaS support team as well as the tools they use.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 266 | How to Cope with Hard Times
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about some of the hard times they have come across in their entrepreneurial careers. They also give a list of eight coping strategies to help with these hardships.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 265 | The Absolute Bare Minimum You Should Know About Segmenting Your Email List
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about the bare minimum you should know about segmenting your email list. They discuss the different stages your customers can be categorized as and how to target them specifically in order to get them to the next stage.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 264 | How to Identify New Product Ideas
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to identify new product ideas. They discuss some of the different stages you will encounter while researching a new business idea and some techniques to get the most out of it.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 263 | Per User Pricing for SaaS, Drip Email Sequences for Freemium, and SaaS Subscription vs. Commission Pricing
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike take a group of listener questions including Per User Pricing for SaaS, Drip Email Sequences for Freemium, and SaaS Subscription vs. Commission Pricing.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 262 | 13 Signs You Should Kill an Idea You’re Validating
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike make a list of 13 signs you should kill an idea you’re validating. These are different signals that can be negative to the idea actually working.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 261 | Interview with Nathan Chan of Foundr Magazine
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob interviews Nathan Chan of Foundr Magazine about his journey to success and what he has learned along the way.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 260 | What is the One Metric That Matters?
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about the one metric that matters. The idea of focusing on one metric at a time, the metric that is helping move your business forward.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 259 | Making Your First $2k from Products, Whether to Look For a Co-Founder, Rehabbing an Existing Product, and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike take a number of listener questions including talking about making your first $2k from products, whether to look for a Co-Founder, and rehabbing an existing product.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 258 | 9 Common A/B Testing Mistakes
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about the common mistakes people make when A/B testing.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 257 | Mistakes Founders Make in Getting Traction
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Gabriel Weinberg, founder of DuckDuckGo, about the mistakes founders make in getting traction. They also discuss Gabriel’s new book “Traction: How Any Startup Can Achieve Exposlive Customer Growth”.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 256 | The 10 Elements of Highly Effective SaaS Landing Pages
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike put together a list of the most common things that are working and effective for SaaS landing pages.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 255 | Moving on From AuditShark
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about Mike’s decision to move on from AuditShark. They discuss events and reasons leading up to Mike’s decision as well as lessons learned along the way.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 254 |  Planning Your Move from Day Job to Product
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about planning your move from day job to product. They give you seven milestones to follow to help you get closer to working from your business full time.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 253 | Key Takeaways from MicroConf Europe 2015
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about their takeaways from Microconf Europe 2015.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 252 | The Unconventional MVP with Jesse Mecham
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Jesse Mecham about the unconventional MVP. Jesse talks about his background and company as well as his first product he put out in the market.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 251 | Email Marketing Demystified with Matthew Paulson
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In the episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike interviews Matthew Paulson, founder of marketbeat.com, about email marketing. They also discuss his upcoming book “Email Marketing Demystified”.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 250 | 10 Ways to Use Engineering as Marketing
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about 10 ways to use engineering as marketing. They define engineering as marketing and discuss how it can help generate awareness of your company and product.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 249 | Finding Your Competitors’ Customers, Pre-validating a WordPress Plugin, How to Hire a CTO, and More Listener Questions
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about finding your competitors’ customers, pre-validating a WordPress plugin, how to hire a CTO, and they answer more listener questions.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 248 | 14 Ideas for High Impact Lead Magnets
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about 14 ideas for high impact lead magnets. They discuss the types of things you can offer in exchange for email addresses.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 247 | Focusing on People vs. Process
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss valuing people versus process. They dive into the question whether you have to hire exception people or run your business based on process.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 246 | 9 Reasons Why People Won’t Buy Your Product (And How to Fix Them)
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about reasons people won’t buy your product and how to fix it. They discuss common objections people have about products and why it prevents them from making a purchase.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 245 | Tips for Fighting Stress and Anxiety as a Founder
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about tips for fighting stress and anxiety as a founder.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 244 | Competition, Transparency and Funding with Baremetrics Founder Josh Pigford
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob interviews Josh Pigford, the founder of baremetrics about competition, transparency, and funding.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 243 | The Tools We Use to Run Our Startups
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about the different tools they use to run their startups.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 242 | Startup Accelerators, Working On vs Working In Your Business and Hiring a Developer as a Non-Technical Founder
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike answer questions about accelerators, the difference between working on and in your business, and the benefits of transparency.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 241 | Why Entrepreneurship Is the Logical Path With Guest Taylor Pearson
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss why entrepreneurship is the logical path. They interview Taylor Pearson and talk about his book “The End of Jobs”.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 240 | Podcasts for Startup Founders
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about podcasts for startup founders. They list and classify their favorite podcasts and discuss them in detail.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 239 | Email List Building From Zero to 1,000: Part II
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike continue their discussion on e-mail list building zero to 1,000. They talk about the best approaches that they see working today for people trying to build a product list or launch list.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 238 | Email List Building From Zero to 1,000: Part I
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike do a short series on e-mail list building from zero to a thousand. They talk about how to build an e-mail list and some of the different strategies that you can use to take it through the different steps.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 237 | The Biggest Roadblocks to Your Success
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about of the biggest roadblocks to your success. After 5 years of additional knowledge and experience they revisit the topic and share some new insights.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 236 | Making a Full-Time Income With Online Training
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike interview Andrew Connell and talk to him about making a full time income with online training.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 235 | When Is It Time To Level Up?
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike help you answer the question, when is it time to level up? They address how to think through the process and what concerns there might be to leveling up.

episodes.seriesTitle: Startups For the Rest of Us
episodes.title: Episode 234 | Eight Things We Wish We Knew When We Started Out
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike revisit eight things they wish they knew when they were starting out. After five years of additional knowledge and experience they share some new tasks on the topic.

episodes.title: Episode 233 | 7 Takeaways from MicroConf Vegas 2015
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss their seven takeaways from MicroConf 2015.

episodes.title: Episode 232 | How to Design a Killer Client Demo
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike talk about how to design a killer client demo. They put together a basic four step outline that will help you take your customer to the next step.

episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Rob and Mike discuss breaking through SaaS plateaus with Ruben Gamez.

episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Sherry Walling and Ali Taber discuss what it’s like being married to a founder and share their experiences on how they balance work and family life.

episodes.title: Episode 229 | 8 Years to Overnight Success with Phil Derksen
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For The Rest Of Us, Mike and Rob interview Phil Derksen and talk about his eight year journey to overnight success.

episodes.title: Episode 228 | 9 Must-Read Books for Founders
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For the Rest Of Us, Mike and Rob discuss 9 must read books for founders. They compile a list of book s that are tactical, deal with mindset, and how to setup and work remotely.

episodes.title: Episode 227 | How to Deal With Haters
episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For the Rest Of Us, Mike and Rob discuss how to deal with haters, the different types of haters and strategies you can use to deal with them.

episodes.author: Mike Taber and Rob Walling
episodes.summary: In this episode of Startups For the Rest of Us, Mike and Rob define churn, talk about the different varieties, explain the different ranges you can expect, how to calculate churn, and present ideas on how to reduce it.
